title: 1970, American Top 40, AT40, American Top Forty, Casey Kasem, Ra
description:
"The biggest hits are yet to come as we count 'em down on American Top 40."


This isn't the best recording I've ever gotten but all the songs are there and it gets the job done.

American Top 40 with Casey Kasem aired on radio from July 4, 1970 until August 6, 1988. This is a recording of a rebroadcast from internet radio.

As of this broadcast:

The top selling female vocal group of all time places a hit in the top 40. As of this countdown, these girls had put more #1 hits on the chart than any other American singing group in the history of pop music.

There is a hit that took four years to reach the top 40 from it's first release, during which time eleven other songs by the same singer made it.

Three of this week's five new songs debut so high up on the chart, Casey doesn't even get to play them until the second hour.

Casey remembers a woman who won an Academy Award at the age of fourteen for her role as Helen Keller in "The Miracle Worker.' She was the youngest actress ever to win an Academy Award.

There is a singer in the countdown that was once credited by President Lyndon B. Johnson with preventing more death and destruction than any other entertainer in the business.
